page.title: 17FREE TIME IN AMPNEY CRUCIS
page.content: Gardening is the most popular pastime. Nearly all the gardens are beautifully kept. There are over 400 apple, 111 pear and 150 plum trees in the village alone. Swimming is the most popular sport. Tennis, walking, football, painting, sewing and reading are also popular pastimes, so are flower arranging, darts and skittles. Listening to music is enjoyed by many people but few admitted to watching television. Outside the village there is fox hunting. The{Vale of the White Horse} hunt hunts the area. There are regular pheasant shoots in season and a few days beating for the shoot is one way to pass the day and end up with a brace of birds. Cycling has become a much more common activity. There are several sprightly septuagenarians and older.
